clinical_study.brief_title: Blended Depression Therapy: Cognitive Behaviour Therapy Face-to-face and Via Internet
clinical_study.official_title: European Comparative Effectiveness Research on Internet-based Depression in Sweden (E-compared) Treatment). A Randomized Controlled Trial Comparing Blended Internet and Face-to-face CBT Against Treatment as Usual

brief_summary.textblock: To asses the clinical effectiveness of blended cognitive behavior therapy (CBT): face-to-face and internet-based treatment for adults with Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) in primary care compared to treatment as usual.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is part of a EU-project. Participants are recruited via regular routes from primary care settings. Following the Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview (M.I.N.I.) participants will be randomly allocated to either blended treatment for 10 sessions/weeks or to treatment as usual. We will include 150 participants in total.

primary_outcome.measure: Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology Self-Report (QIDS
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in symptoms of depression. Time Frame: 0, 3, 6 and 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Symptoms of depression measured by the QIDS. The QIDS is a questionnaire that screens for depressive symptoms and assesses depression severity.

secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life will be assessed with the EQ-5D-5L (EuroQol). The EQ-5D-5L is a self-report questionnaire which measures health related quality of life.
Patient's satisfaction with the treatment is assessed with Client Satisfaction Questionnaire (CSQ-8)
Patients' expectancy of treatment will be assessed with the credibility and expectancy questionnaire (CEQ)
Satisfaction with the internet platform will be evaluated with the system usability scale (SUS)
The PHQ-9 is a nine-item mood module that can be used to screen and to diagnose patients with depressive disorders.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time Frame: 0 months ( three weeks after started treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The therapeutic alliance between therapists and patient will be assessed with the short version of the Working Alliance Inventory (WAI-SF).

secondary_outcome.measure: Trimbos and iMTA questionnaire on Costs associated with Psychiatric illness (TIC-P)
secondary_outcome.description: Health service uptake and production loss due to illness will be measured with the Trimbos and iMTA Questionnaires on Costs Associated with Psychiatric Illness (TiC-P)

arm_group.description: 10 weeks of four face-to-face Cognitive behavioral therapy sessions and internet-based CBT as a complement and support to the four sessions.
Usual course of antidepressants and management in primary care (e.g medication and supportive counselling).

intervention.description: CBT based on behavioral activation and cognitive therapy techniques including homework
Treatment as usual in primary care including antidepressants and counselling

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- depressive symptoms according to DSM-IV
- have access to a computer with internet connection
- have good knowledge of the Swedish language
Exclusion Criteria:
- recent (during last 6 weeks) change in psychiatric medication
- presently in any other psychological treatment
- severe depression
- suicidal ideation
